channel.title: Easiest Model Outlining EVER! [TEXTURE OUTLINING] NEW MODEL MAKERS LOOK HERE!
channel.description:
I recently figured out a nice and easy shortcut to make really good models, here it is.
First find a picture of what you would like to make an outline of and download the picture to your comp. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/1.jpg[/img]
Next open Metaseq, click primitive, then click the box then make a box almost as big as metaseq workspace. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/2.jpg[/img]
Next go into mat1 & click ref in the texture section. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/3.jpg[/img]
Find the picture you downloaded earlier and open it up. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/4.jpg[/img]
Click Ok. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/5.jpg[/img]
Now click create in the middle of the screen, it should have been left there to click. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/6.jpg[/img]
The picture you chose will pop up. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/7.jpg[/img]
Next make a new object. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/8.jpg[/img]
This should come up. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/9.jpg[/img]
Now click create, then both, then line. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/10.jpg[/img]
Now start to outline your model by clicking the edges, first make sure to select obj2, you wont see the dots until you delete obj1. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/11.jpg[/img]
Delete obj1. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/12.jpg[/img]
And voila now you have a nice and neat model outline, to see how to make this a model go to my, making models from scratch sticky. [IMG]http://i453.photobucket.com/albums/qq251/RuneModelMaker/13.jpg[/img]
ALTERNATIVE IMAGE LOADING BY laserchaos OF RUNESTATUS
[IMG]http://img68.imageshack.us/img68/8505/step1vl1.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img75.imageshack.us/img75/4386/step2xr2.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img357.imageshack.us/img357/1981/step3vr5.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img206.imageshack.us/img206/5827/step4oq7.png[/img]

item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

u can do somethin similar with blender… but anyways. i dislike this guide cuz now 1,000 idiots will just outline things and think theyre ‘modeling from scratch’ while they are semi-modeling. all this is is drawing a 2d image, pasting a 2nd one and joining verticies. no model skill their. ohwell, i guess atleast ill see less shit models. though theyll all be traced -.-

item.title: Easiest Model Outlining EVER! [TEXTURE OUTLINING] NEW MODEL MAKERS LOOK HERE!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Nice,
This is too complicated for kids though, try using background images instead.

  1. menu->view->set background images. (use the pers one)
  2. click the Img button (just above the 3D display)
  3. on the left panel, under the command tab, click BkImg to resize and move the background image (SHIFT+mouse to retain aspect ratio)

To draw ‘flat’, press F1-F3

Glad someone finally worked out how to model

Read full topic
